text: Use enumerate() to get index and value together while looping.
List comprehensions make Python code shorter and faster.
Use zip() to iterate over multiple lists at the same time.
Use dict.get(key, default) to avoid KeyError exceptions.
Convert a list to set() to remove duplicate values instantly.
Use any() to check if at least one condition is True.
Use all() when all conditions must be True in a list.
Use f-strings for clean and fast string formatting.
Use sorted(iterable, key=...) for complex sorting logic.
Use enumerate with zip for clean multi-list loops.
